content: this legal text discusses a court ruling in a community property dispute case the court has deemed the applications from the involved parties admissible and has assigned various properties to each party these properties include apartments a medical office a garage storage rooms and a plot of land for parking spaces the courts decision is based on principles of the civil code such as succession division allocation reversibility and inheritance division rules the case involves the inheritance of a deceased person with the plaintiff mr mm suing the defendants who are the heirs the court has made decisions regarding the division of the estate and community property dissolution the defendants have disputed the claims and argued for their share of the inheritance an expert witness was appointed to assess the properties value the court rejected certain claims and counterclaims from both parties the division of properties will be based on the expert witnesss findings and the principle of drawing lots cash balances that the defendants need to pay each other have also been determined the court considered the deceased persons donations during their lifetime and ruled on their inclusion in the inheritance the court addressed the costs of the case including the expert witness fees which will be shared by the parties the court ruling orders the assignment of specific properties to each party along with a cash settlement the judgment will be transcribed in the land records jurisdiction and the parties will bear the costs of transcription and property fractionation the court compensates the litigation and expert report costs
